A RUSTLING is heard in the bushes, and Zowie emerges into building firelight, flashing his fangs at Gus. His eyes G Gus freezes, studying Zowie. Zowie inches forward, poised for the attack.

Call off your dog, Drew. Drew shifts his eyes from Zowie to Gus, too terrified to a command. Zowie brushes past Drew and Geoff, moving in on Gus. Gus' eyes shift to burning cross at his side. With a swif he kicks over the cross and presses it into his grip. Swinging the cross like a primitive weapon, Gus connects side of Zowie's head. Zowie spins a full circle from the impact. But he lands o fours. Unphased. Taking the next step toward Gus. There's something clearly not of this world in Zowie's vicious st
(terrified)
Drew, call him off! All Drew can manage is a faint appeal.
Zowie... Zowie goes for Gus, launching into the air...

...and sinking his glistening fangs into Gus' neck. AN ERUPTION OF BLOOD showers the closest headstone. Gus comes helplessly tumbling down with the weight of the SCREAMS are suddenly cut short as Zowie rips out his thro arms flail weakly at his sides, then grow still. Drew and Geoff stare at the scene, wide-eyed with shock. Zowie looks up from Gus' neck with dripping, red fangs. F moment, his eyes settle on Drew. Then Zowie bolts off,  disappearing into the night.
Oh, God. Oh, God... Drew's eyes shift to Geoff, whose face is flushed with si fear.
(a whisper)

Is he dead? In dazed shock, Drew moves in for a closer look at the bo Gus' eyes are wide open. Blood is still pumping in rhythm jugular with each weakening beat of his heart. It's a gru image against the roaring fire. Drew kneels at Gus' side. He wants to touch him. To shake awake, but with every attempt, he draws his hand back.
Is he breathing? Can you hear him breathing? Drew leans forward, turning his ear toward Gus' gaping mo as he inches closer...

His hand jerks up and closes around Drew's neck. Gus star him with his crazed menace. Drew SCREAMS. His fingers claw at Gus' hand, desperate to loose... ...but then, Gus' hand relaxes as his last, dying ounce o strength fades away. Drew shrinks back, crouching over the lifeless body as th firelight dances over it. He turns his tear-filled gaze t
Oh man, Geoff... we killed him... we killed him... (beat)
What're we gonna do? Geoff draws closer and looks down into the dead man's fac

We could bring him back. Drew's eyes widen at the suggestion. And now, GAZING DOWN on Gus' body, and on the boys, WE PU INTO A SLOW SPIRAL... We move ever higher, until we are LOOKING DOWN UPON THE E SEMATARY. At the SOUND of a shovel cutting into rocky soi
Three quick shots: A SHOVEL sinking into the earth. GUS falling head down into the grave, landing with a heav SOIL covering Gus' lifeless face.

Amanda is pacing back and forth on the porch, checking he every few steps. She sighs with relief as... Drew appears from the darkness of the woods. Drew dismounts his bike and carries it up the front porch strangely silent. His clothes and face are caked with dir
Jesus, Drew, do you know what time it is? Did Gus ever find you? Drew moves on past her into the house.
(calling after him)
Drew? Drew, what happened?
(trying not to lose it)
Nothing happened, Mom. We just ditched Gus, that's all... Drew pauses and stares out into the unknown darkness of t

Chase is in the study, perusing some files. He looks into hallway as Geoff arrives home, then glances at the clock. late. Very late. Chase rises. He's both angry and relieved. Right now, tho anger's winning out.
Were you drinking? Geoff absently shakes his head. He slumps back against th drained from the night's horrors.
Drew's Mom called hours ago, the rest of the kids were back by ten. Where the hell were you boys? Geoff shrugs, trying to mask his uneasiness.
Just out.
"Out." Well that's great, Geoff. (beat)
Look, I've been letting you get away with a lot these past few weeks, but I'm not going to stand for crap like this. I don't care if it's Halloween... it's a school night, and if you do this again...
(cutting him off)
I'm really tired, Dad... can I just go to sleep? Chase stops and looks at his son. Geoff's exhaustion is s evident.
(sighing)
Go on... we'll talk about this in the morning. Geoff nods and heads for the stairs.

THE CLOCK is creeping up on 2AM... THUNDER rumbles outside in the distance and rain starts t the window panes. Geoff's eyelids fall beneath unbearable weight and he nod sleep. Tiger is sprawled out on the blanket against his c Slowly, we move back towards the window... In a flash of LIGHTNING--

APPEARS OUTSIDE. Washed in the haunting white glow. Strea mud. Caked with blood. Staring in at Geoff. Geoff is jolted awake by the delayed clap of THUNDER and gaze to the window. Before he can focus... ...the pulse of lightning fades away. And with it, Gus' f darkness remains beyond the window pane. Geoff returns his gaze to the bedroom, unaware of Gus' ap He sinks back to his pillow, already hurtling towards sle more.
MOVING IN ON the house, WE SINGLE OUT a rain-obscured win the ground floor, the window to Drew's bedroom.
Drew is sound asleep, curled up under the sheets. He clut pillow like a life preserver.
Drew! Drew's eyes flutter open. He turns towards the window. No hears some activity outside. And then Gus' hushed voice.
Drew, buddy. I lost my keys. Drew goes saucer-eyed. He swallows the swelling lump in h and rises from his bed.
Drew steadies his quivering fingers just enough to sink t into the deadbolt on the back door. Drawing the CREAKING open, he gazes out back.
(scared shitless)

Gus? Nothing moves outside. The longer Drew watches, the more each shadow becomes. Spooked, Drew steps back inside, qui closing the door. He locks it back up again. When he turns around, he's face to face with GUS. Drew stiffens, backing into the wall.
H-how'd you get in? Gus offers a nightmarish grin and raises his hand, dangli keys.
Found 'em. Drew's eyes follow a flow of blood from Gus' neck to the Gus looks down at his dirty, bloody footprints. He's trac all over the linoleum.
I'm makin' a mess of your mother's kitchen floor... (beat)

I need a shower... Gus turns without another word and heads for the stairs. Drew's mouth drops in utter astonishment as he watches Gu clumsily climbing the stairs. After a moment, he returns his attention to the bloody ki floor. Tearing off a wad of paper towels, he wets them an to mop up Gus' tracks.

Gazing vacantly at his reflection, Gus covers his ravaged with a gauze strip, wrapping it around the circumference neck again and again and again. Behind him, the shower is running, filling up the bathroo steam. Finishing the dressing off with a sloppy tape job, Gus re the pajamas hanging nearby. He lazily buttons the buttons to notice their alignment is off. He never did bother to He's still covered with mud.
Gus enters from the steamy bathroom. The shower is still Amanda stirs, sleepy eyes focusing on him.

Gus, hon. I'm sorry about tonight. You coming to bed? Gus lifts the covers and climbs in. With him comes the ch death. Gus presses up behind her. His hand moves beneath sheets, finding its way over the curve of her waist, care Amanda shivers.
God, you're ice cold... (turning)
...and you smell! Lord, what did you get yourself into? It's then that Amanda sees the bandage around Gus' neck. seeping through the gauze.
My God, Gus, what happened? Amanda reaches out to touch him, but Gus stops her hand s the bandage. Instead, he leans forward and clutches one o breasts. Amanda tries to twist away.
Gus... stop it! What's wrong with you?! But Gus doesn't stop. He throws himself on top of Amanda, forcing her back onto the bed.

Gus!!! Amanda's hands beat at Gus' face and back, to no apparent With one arm forced against Amanda's throat, he rips open nightgown with the other. We pull away from Amanda's struggles, back to the bathroo shower running on and on, cloaking the bedroom in steam.
Geoff is riding along the highway, his backpack full of s books. Drew is waiting on the shoulder ahead. When Geoff  approaches, Drew hops on his bike, getting up to speed.
Geoff keeps glancing at Drew, waiting for him to say some Drew maintains his enigmatic expression.
Well? Drew nods. Geoff's eyes widen in disbelief.

Picture this... Gus comes down to breakfast and he doesn't say a word. He even kind of smiles, like he forgot he hates me. And then you know what he does? He serves me an extra helping of pancakes... (beat)

I asked him if I was still grounded... "no." I asked him if you could spend the night, and he nods. It's like we're a family. A real family. The words have their own meaning for Geoff, who stares to ahead in deep thought.
It's weird...
What do you mean?
It's like he's not Gus anymore. He's different. You know, like Zowie... They share a chuckle that ends in silent uneasiness.

Chase enters with a stack of files tucked under his arm. organizes them in the large filing cabinet with the other listens to his messages on the answering machine. The current caller sounds a little annoyed...
...Doctor Matthews, this is Elliot Rudman at the university. I've looked over the blood specimen you sent us on canine Zowie... Chase abandons the filing and immediately returns the cal it RINGS...
Knock, Knock, Doc. A MOTHER and TWO TODDLERS are standing in the doorway to office, trying not to intrude on his call.
(quiet whisper)
We saw your sign. Are there any kitties left? Chase studies them. They look like decent people.
Take your pick. They're in the boarding area. You can go on back. Chase turns away as his phone call is answered.
Elliot, it's Chase...
ELLIOT RUDMAN has the phone tucked under his chin, in the an autopsy. The WHIRR of the saw drowns out his words as the dome off a dog's skull.
I didn't get that... The pathologist turns off the saw. His words become audib
...I said next time it might help if you took the blood sample while the animal was still alive... The comment hits Chase out of left field.
What?
I don't know what you expected to find, Matthews. There's nothing wrong with the antigens, nothing to indicate an unusual death...
Wait, there must be some mix-up. He was... the dog is alive.
Not this dog. There wasn't enough oxygen in those red cells to pump life into a flea. Chase is baffled, speechless.
You took over for Doctor Yolander?
Yes... why?
Because the last person that sent me blood from a dead animal was Yolander...

The kennels have been cleaned up, but the room retains it dimly lit quality. The DRIP of a faucet reverberates from the far corner. The mother enters with a toddler clinging to each hand. T smiles fade at the unsettling surroundings. Slowly, they the row of kennels.
Where are the kitties?
(into the phone)
Look, this is ridiculous... Suddenly, BLOOD-CURDLING SCREAMS pierce the air. Chase dr phone and rushes out of the office...

The toddlers are screaming at the top of their lungs. Mom burying their heads in her dress. Chase bursts in as the mother hastily retreats for the ex horrified eyes flash by Chase. In an instant, she and the are gone. Chase remains alone, moving down the long row of kennels mounting trepidation... Zowie's cage is empty. Chase shifts his troubled gaze to the... DRIP DRIP DRIP... as a PUDDLE OF BLOOD forms on the floor Chase raises his eyes...
Nothing but bloody ribbons of torn flesh are left of the dangling from the grid gate. DRIPPING. Chase looks away as a new level of fear runs through him.

Jesus... It's too gruesome even for a man of Chase's background. F the gag reflex, he searches the room for the missing dog. ...and then he spots the broken glass window vent along t And the pile of blood-spattered shards laying on the tile
Clyde, Stevie, and Brad are loitering near the front bike Clyde's smoking away. As Geoff and Drew come out of the school, the trio moves intercept them.
Hey! Just then, Chase's van pulls at the curb, interrupting wh trouble was about to happen. Clyde looks from the van to Geoff, and falls back.
Saved by the bell... Chase hurriedly rolls down the passenger window as Geoff approach.
Can I sleep over at Drew's tonight? Chase is preoccupied with other concerns.
Yeah... that's fine... (beat)
Listen, Drew, I got the tests back on Zowie. He's not well. Don't ask me how, but he got out this afternoon... Geoff and Drew exchange concerned looks.

If he finds his way home, call me, no matter what the hour, okay? And don't try to approach him. Whatever he's got might be  infectious. Understand? The boys nod their heads. Chase masks his anxiety with a weary smile. With a wave, up, leaving the boys.
A MAP of Maine is unfolded on the passenger seat. Chase i car phone.
Can I have the address for Quentin Yolander? Chase jots an address down on the map. He turns the van u mountain road, winding through the towering pines.
A remote, rustic dwelling nestled into the desolate backw
QUENTIN YOLANDER rocks back in his thick hide chair. His closed off from daylight by the extensive blinds. He's holding a SMALL POODLE in his lap. Its big brown eye staring back at him.

You'd be so much more interesting with blue eyes... And now, ONE OF THE POODLE'S EYES POPS OUT. Yolander's fi comes through from beneath the eye socket. On closer examination, WE REALIZE that the dog is not ali all. Yolander has his hand inside the hollowed-out carcas He carefully looks over a container of glass eyes on his selects the right shade of blue. A shot of whiskey rests Yolander reaches up into the poodle's belly and fits the securely into place. There's a KNOCK at the door. Yolander ignores it. Maybe h Another KNOCK. Yolander turns towards the door, annoyed a intrusion. And behind that annoyance, there's a touch of PULLING BACK, we see the rest of the room. Stuffed animal crowded from floor to ceiling. A product of Yolander's ob with TAXIDERMY.
I'm immortalizing a poodle. State your business! Yolander presses some stuffing into the poodle's gut and sew up the stomach.
Doctor Yolander. This is Chase Matthews. I've moved into your offices in Ludlow... Yolander's attention remains on the needle as he meticulo stitches the belly.
(continuing)

...I sent a blood sample out for analysis. They tell me I sent them the blood of a dead animal... At this, Yolander breaks his concentration. The needle pr hand. Blood oozes from the puncture, dripping onto the do stomach.
...a dog... Yolander rises from his seat and swings open the door. Chase stands in the doorway, startled. It doesn't take a figure out that the good Doctor is drunk.
(glaring)
Why are you bothering me about this? Can't you leave it be?
I... um... Chase glances to the right and steps back...

is perched nearby, frozen in mid-pounce. It takes a secon Chase to register that the bobcat has been stuffed. Now Chase sees the rest of the room... a whole zoo of stu animals, looking like a rural version of the Bates Motel.
(momentarily thrown)
...the pathologist... he said that you had reported a similar  incident... with a cat...
The Creed cat, that's right. Bastard's name was "Church". (grins)
Let me guess. Your dog's tissue isn't healing, pupils aren't dilating... maybe you can't find a heartbeat?
Exactly! I thought it might be some sort of blood condition... immune deficiency or... Quentin Yolander laughs. It's disconcerting.
There's no "blood condition." The dog isn't sick, it's dead. (drawing closer)

And so was Creed's cat. And so was his wife the night she was killed for the second time... As Yolander moves forward, Chase backs up. He bumps into shelf of stuffed creatures. To his right, A RAVEN sits fr its perch. Chase regards Yolander as being completely ins
(menacing)
You want some advice, friend? You get in your car, you pick up your family... and you get the hell out of that town.

Well... uh... thanks... Chase continues to back out of the door. On his way out, into the stuffed raven's perch... ...only this raven isn't stuffed. It spreads its wings an SCREECHES. Chase just about jumps out of his skin, tripping out of t doorway.

Gus reaches into the cage and grabs a rabbit by the ears. casually snaps the neck. Laying the limp carcass on a stu cutting board, he quickly skins it. Hanging above the cages, there is now a line of furry pel a dozen. Drew and Geoff are on the porch, looking on.
I guess we're having rabbit for dinner. Gus hangs the freshly skinned fur to dry and violently sn another hare from the cage.

The dinner from Hell. Geoff splats a helping of mashed po onto his plate, all the while keeping a wary eye on Gus.. Gus is serving himself a chunk of rabbit. It hits the edg plate, teetering on the rim. He passes the dish on. Gus meets Geoff's gaze. For a moment, there's a deadened, look in Gus' eyes. Then slowly, a limp smile creeps over sending a chill up Geoff's spine. Geoff averts Gus' stare. Gus helps himself to potatoes an the plate on. He lets go of it short of reaching Drew. On quick hands save it from hitting the table. Amanda comes to the table with a dish of LIMA BEANS. She a cold, hateful stare and sets the limas down. She's stil over last night. Gus dishes a sloppy scoop and passes it toward Drew. Like he lets it drop too early. This time Drew doesn't save it lima beans shower the floor.

God damnit, Gus! This isn't funny! Amanda fetches a dishtowel and kneels to clean up the mes Geoff and Drew exchange quick glances. As Geoff reaches f salt... ...Gus intercepts his wrist. Geoff gulps. Gus drops his jaw, revealing a gooey mass of food. But th smile and the look in his eyes convey dementia rather tha playfulness. Geoff and Drew can't believe their eyes. They laugh uncom There's no other response. Gus LAUGHS too... awkward, terrible laughter. Spitting ou over his shirt and plate as he does so. The boys stop laughing, but Gus just keeps on going. Amanda stares at Gus and carries the mess out of the room Through his laughter, Gus' bandage has slipped down, expo of his ragged wound. The wound glistens, oozing CLOTTED B GOOEY PUS. Drew hesitantly reaches for Gus' neck, readjusting the ba Grossed out, Geoff averts his eyes and sets his fork asid
Geoff and Drew enter. Drew swiftly secures the deadbolts door.
What was that all about? You think he's trying to scare us?

I don't know but I'm not taking any chances... Drew opens the chest at the foot of his bed and produces SHOTGUN. A box full of shells spill as he withdraws the g Cracking open the chamber, Drew loads two shells into the
A moonlit horizon. Unmoving. Silent. The kind of silence pulls at the darkest recesses of imagination. And now, A LONE FIGURE appears on the horizon. It's Zowie at a deliberate pace.
Zowie takes pause. The TINKLING of his collar tags resume drops over the horizon line, cutting down the hill.

Chase sits in the den, looking exhausted and disheveled. of him, the t.v. is on. RENEE'S FACE stares out at us. Ch the remote and rises, moving to the back door. He checks the deadbolt, then secures the chain link as a From somewhere outside, we hear a DOG HOWL. Chase's eyes drop to the DOGGY DOOR, a holdover from the owner. Chase bends down and latches the door. Now he pauses at his desk... considers... then pulls some of the bottom drawer. It's a gun.
Chase moves to the front of the house, securing that door Satisfied, he turns off the light and heads upstairs...

head_text.subj: WE STAY AT THE FOOT OF THE STAIRS -

text: MOVING INTO DARKNESS, shadow and form begin to take shape a low GROWL and see a flash of RED EYES. It's Zowie. Alre the house.
Coming through the door from the downstairs, Chase stops RENEE is on the bed. Clothed in a negligee. Lying across of rose petals. Her eyes meet his with powerful longing.
Chase. I miss you so much...
(dry-mouthed)
Renee... Chase approaches. Slowly. Fearful that this is all a drea Renee reaches out her hand. They touch. This is not a dre

Oh God... Chase absently sets his gun on the bedside table as Renee his body to hers. They kiss. Once. Twice. Not a dream. Renee rolls Chase over, forcefully climbing on top. Chase down into the center of the bed as Renee straddles him. Slowly, Renee slips off the top of her negligee...
(a whisper)

I can come back, Chase... ...and sinks down on top of him, kissing him hungrily. Her nipples graze his chest, then her breasts flatten as grinds her hips against his. Almost instantly, the weight of her grows unbearable. Cha to pull his mouth from hers, to breathe...
No... Too heavy. There is no pleasure in his words, just unmitigated horro Renee's body comes down on him harder.
...can't breathe... I can't...
pop open, frenzied, AS HE COMES OUT OF HIS DREAM. Chase is alone on the bed, but he's still feeling the wei pressing down on him...

is laying on his chest, staring back at him, rearing his a growl... Zowie LUNGES forward, jaws flashing, and Chase twists sid GNASHING TEETH connect with Chase's shoulder, then with t pillows where Chase's head used to be. A BLIZZARD OF DOWN ERUPTS... Chase scrambles out of bed, flailing for the gun on the b table... THE GUN spins out of reach and across the floor... Chase DIVES for the gun and reaches it just as Zowie leap floor. In a panic, Chase FIRES WILD... Zowie abruptly turns and SMASHES through the bedroom wind sending glass flying.
Zowie slides down the room and leaps to the ground below, disappearing into the night.

Chase looks on in terror. Finally he pulls his eyes away shattered window... ...and catches a glimpse of something in the dresser mirr Something that sends a chill up his spine. The flurry of down feathers is floating to the mattress. intermingling with the feathers are a handful of ROSE PET slowly settling to the bed.

Chase is bare-chested at the mirror, applying a dressing dog bite on his shoulder. Marjorie appears in the doorway with a basket of laundry. stops short at the sight of Chase standing there in his b Chase catches her reflection in the mirror and is startle
I didn't mean to... I was going to empty the hamper... Chase turns, shaking off the scare.
It's okay. Marjorie's eyes can't help but fix on the dog bites scatt Chase's chest and arms.
What happened to you?
I had a little run-in with Zowie.
You sure did... Marjorie sets the laundry aside.

Here, let me do that... Marjorie looks over the antiseptics Chase has laid out on sink. Saturating a wad of gauze with hydrogen peroxide, s cleanses the gashes on his arms. There's nothing overtly sexual in her actions, but the ge of her touch doesn't go unnoticed by Chase.
I hope he doesn't have rabies.
He doesn't. I don't know what he has, but I'm hoping to God it's not infectious... Chase stops and looks at Marjorie's reflection in the mir
Marjorie... what do you know about the Creed murders? Marjorie stiffens for a moment. Obviously the Creeds are spot for the people in this town.

Did you ever play that game where you pass a story down a row of people and see how screwed up it gets by the time it's done? People say Louis Creed's son came back from the dead and it drove him crazy... (she rolls her eyes)

He killed his wife and himself, and that's the end of story. Anything else belongs in the National Enquirer. Marjorie tapes the bandage over Chase's shoulder too tigh Chase's groan snaps her back to the reality at hand.
Sorry. Now tell me what that has to do with Zowie? Chase closes his eyes, shutting out the pain.
I wish I knew.
Chase approaches the counter, looking to the ELDERLY LIBR assistance.
What are you looking for, Hon.
Do you have anything on the Creed murders? I can't find the  microfilm from that period... The librarian's smile vanishes. She lowers her voice, foc attention on some paperwork.
We don't keep anything on file from that far back.
But you've got files from the previous years...

We have nothing on the Creed murders, sir. Can I get you something else? Chase looks around and realizes that a dozen hostile eyes him. TOWNSPEOPLE withholding a dark secret. Chase slowly backs away, eager to escape the field of hos stares.
Geoff and Drew have parked their bikes beneath the bridge sit on the bank of the creek below, watching the water ru Geoff is lost in thought.
Do you think everyone that came back would be like Gus?
I don't know... (thinking)
...maybe it depends on what you were like before you...
(finishing)
Dies? Drew nods. He tosses a stone into the creek, then looks u sun and sighs.
I gotta go back and do my chores...
Go later... Drew shakes his head.
I can't. Gus'd kill me if I showed up late. The boys reluctantly rise and move to their bikes, walkin the steep grade to the highway.
See you at school Monday? Geoff nods. He looks at Drew. The boy is genuinely fright there's nothing either of them can do. They're trapped in roles as kids. Both boys mount their bikes. Drew turns...
You ever think about running away?
All the time. Drew smiles at this. He waves to Geoff and pedals off.
(calling back)
See ya! Geoff waves and heads off in the opposite direction.
As he moves down the road. Up ahead, we hear the approach of a motorcycle...
rips by on an old junkyard fixer-up MOTORCYCLE, and he's in Geoff's direction. Seeing him, Drew brakes and pulls his bike into a U-turn, furiously to catch up with Geoff.

Now Geoff hears the WHINE of Clyde's motorcycle. He glanc back... Clyde's spotted him, REVVING the engine. Geoff pedals like mad, but it's no use. Clyde is closing him, grinning sadistically. Clyde sweeps in next to him, calling out over the ENGINE.
Well look who's here! Clyde veers right, forcing Geoff towards the shoulder of road...
The ground ahead drops toward a ravine. Geoff has nowhere but down the slope. Clyde is right there beside him... Laughing, Clyde reaches over and grabs ahold of Geoff's h He jerks it sideways...

Oops! Geoff's front wheel turns perpendicular. The bike pitches THROWING Geoff into the dirt ahead... Clyde broadies his bike to a stop. With the engine idling off. Before Geoff can get to his feet, Clyde has picked up Geo and planted it upside down in the dirt.

Guess your Dad's not here to save you now, is he? Clyde gets a handful of Geoff's collar and drags him over the bike. With his free hand, Clyde cranks the pedal. The back wheel spins. Faster and faster.
You ever seen a tire take off a nose? Through the blur of the spokes, WE SEE Geoff, eyes wideni fearfully.
Neither have I. Clyde forces Geoff's face toward the spinning tread.

Might even kill ya. Wheel might chew right into your brains. You could visit your mom. Geoff tries to get a hold on the frame of the bike for le but his arms don't reach beyond the spinning wheel. Clyde is full of deranged glee, fueled by Geoff's fear. But now, A HAND grabs the wool scarf streaming from the b Clyde's neck and yanks him off of Geoff. Clyde reels, finding... GUS standing there behind him. He looks bad. Real bad. Hi bandages are unwound and his ruined neck is still seeping face is unearthly pale. He's deteriorated considerably si yesterday.
(startled)
Jesus Christ, Gus! Gus levels a threatening gaze at Geoff.
Go home. But Geoff remains frozen. Gus fixes him with a stare that turn flesh to stone.
I said... GO HOME!! Geoff snaps out of it and flips his bike over. He gets a start, making a beeline for the highway without ever look
Drew stops short of the ravine, watching from afar as Gus toward Clyde.
Clyde throws up his hands. He's frightened, but he tries up a cocky front.
Come on, Gus, I was just fucking with him... (nervous laughter)
What're you gonna do? Give me a ticket? I mean, shit, Gus... Clyde grows increasingly wary of Gus' evil stare. Gus ste closer.

You can't lay a finger on me... Wrong. Gus lashes out, backhanding Clyde across the face. Clyde falls to the ground, flat on his back, with his nos blood. Terrified. Gus turns around and lifts the idling motorcycle. With on under the back of the seat, and the other working the acc handlebar, Gus advances toward Clyde. Gus kicks the bike into gear and REVS the accelerator. THE REAR WHEEL SPINS. On the pavement it would be moving miles an hour. Clyde can't believe his eyes. Pleading.
Gus... what are you doing?

I'm just fucking with you... Gus plants his foot against Clyde's chest, pinning him, a the spinning rear wheel TOWARD CLYDE'S NECK. The wheel WH a circular saw. Gus lowers the wheel. Then jerks it away, flashing a sadi smile. Just when Clyde thinks Gus is backing off, the wheel come again...
(wailing)

Stop it, man! Stop it!!! Gus gets into the rhythm as he lowers and retracts the sp wheel at the terrified bully. But this time, as the wheel comes down... CLYDE'S WOOL SCARF, defying gravity, gets swept up, swall the GEARS. And along with the scarf, here comes Clyde's SCREAMING fa can only imagine the gruesome instant that follows. BLOOD sprays up over Gus' arms and chest. And then we hea sound of CRUNCHING BONES jamming the motorcycle's gears.
(dead-pan)
Whoops. He bares his teeth in a death's head grin.
Drew has witnessed the killing. He's mortified.
Gus tosses the bloody motorcycle aside, slowly raising hi to where Drew stands. His eyes meet Drew's. Drew hastily jerks his bike around and takes off. Gus starts after him on foot.
Drew rushes through the front door, SLAMMING it behind hi throwing the deadbolt.
Drew climbs onto his bed and grabs his shotgun from the g His fingers shake as he flips off the safety.
Oh man... Just then we hear the CRACKLE of a POLICE P.A. and Gus' a VOICE coming from the yard outside.
(mocking)

This is the Police, come out of the house with your hands up! Gus finishes his words with a burst of FEEDBACK and then MANIACAL LAUGHTER. Drew's eyes go wide with terror. He creeps out into the h clutching the gun.
Drew tries to look out the window. Then we hear a low, gu GROWL. Drew slowly turns... Zowie is standing down the hall, leveling a dead stare. Z takes the first step forward.
(horrified)
No, Zowie! It's me! Pleading, Drew slowly retreats down the hallway. Along the way, he backs right into... GUS, grinning from ear to ear. Drew recoils against the wall, swinging up his shotgun.
Stay back! But Gus just keeps on grinning. He takes a step forward.. Drew pulls the trigger... And CLICK! Nothing happens. The chambers are empty.

Forget something, Drew buddy? Gus raises his hand. He's holding the shotgun shells. He fall to the floor. Suddenly Gus wrenches the gun from Drew's hands. He swing and... ...Drew SCREAMS and ducks beneath the blow, as the shotgu SMASHES a hole in the wall above his head. Gus flings the aside and LUNGES for Drew... Drew races down the hallway to the back door. He turns th The deadbolt has been locked from the inside. Drew's eyes whip to the keyholder on the wall. All the ke are empty. Here comes the JINGLING of keys in Gus' pockets as he com the hall... Drew dashes away from the back door. Gus' eyes shift from Drew's fleeing form to A BOX OF TOOL service closet.
Drew jimmies the knob. Again, the deadbolt is locked from inside. Tears are streaming down Drew's face now. FOOTSTEPS approach. Drew spins around... Gus is advancing, WITH A HAMMER tight in his grip.
(crazed)
You have the right to remain silent... WHAM! Gus SMASHES the hammer into the wall to punctuate h Plaster goes flying.
(continuing)

...while I bash your fucking head in! Drew's eyes dart frantically, looking for a way out. The route of escape is UP THE STAIRS. Down the hallway, Zowie starts running forward. Drew's ca between a rock and a hard place...
You have the right to a lawyer, but you won't need one... He runs for it. Gus charges to intercept him... Drew gets to the stairs first.
...cause you'll be dead! WHAM! Gus brings the hammer down with the claw end leadin sinks into the stair below Drew's feet... Zowie LEAPS past Gus, tearing up the stairs as Gus wrench hammer free...

Drew makes it to the top of the stairs with Zowie right o heels. Drew DIVES into Amanda and Gus' bedroom as... Zowie springs from the floor. Drew SLAMS the door shut, S Zowie. Zowie collapses to the floor, dazed.

Drew throws the latch on the door. Almost immediately, Gu outside, POUNDING at the door with the claw end of the ha Wood splinters fly as the hammer claw sinks through... Drew SCREAMS and goes for one of the dormer windows. It's he can't get it open. From the hallway, Gus violently SMASHES the door again an The door is splintering apart. WE SEE glimpses of Gus thr ragged holes.
Do you understand these rights, Drew buddy?! Drew grabs a chair and HEAVES it through the window...
The bedroom door EXPLODES INWARD and Gus claws his way in room... Wasting no time, Drew climbs through the broken window...

Drew slides down the slant of the roof. He hits the latti takes it to the ground with him. Untangling himself, he gets to his feet... ...and here comes Amanda, ARRIVING HOME. Drew runs for her car, waving his hands, throwing himself path so she'll go no further. She SLAMS on the brakes. Drew pulls open the passenger door and dives inside...
Gus killed Clyde, Mom! He's trying to kill me! Just then, the BACK DOOR flies open. Gus steps out.

Drew, buddy! Daddy's not done yet! Amanda spots the hammer hanging from his grip. Gus cracks smile and FLINGS THE HAMMER at the car... CRACK! The hammer bounces off the windshield, causing it spiderweb.
Go Mom! Go!!! That's all the convincing Amanda needs. She puts the car reverse and stomps on the gas...
Speeding down the highway. Drew and Amanda are mortified. Suddenly, we hear the WAIL of Gus' patrol car coming up f behind. Amanda looks to the rear-view mirror...
Approaching from the road ahead is a POTATO TRUCK.
Amanda hips her head back in front of them. The potato tr blaring its HORN. Gus' car swerves out onto the shoulder, speeding up to ma pace.
Mom!!! Gus cranks the wheel, jumping back onto the road, forcing car into the path of the oncoming truck.
THE DRIVER stands on the BRAKES.

head_text.subj: THE POTATO TRUCK COLLIDES WITH AMANDA'S CAR. HEAD ON.

text: Thousands of potatoes explode from the rear of the truck, obscuring our view.

head_text.subj: WE HEAR THE HORRIFYING SOUNDS OF CRUNCHING METAL. CRUNCHI

text: Gus' vehicle speeds past. WE HOLD on the mess of twisted Clearly there are no survivors.

Geoff enters first. Wearing a dark suit. Looking pale and inside. Chase follows, dressed in black. It's obvious the to a funeral. Without a word, Geoff heads up the stairs. Chase watches feeling utterly helpless.

Chase exits from his bedroom, pulling a sweater over a mo change of clothes. He cocks his head at the SOUNDS of Geo about in the attic above. The door atop the attic stairway is barely ajar. Chase wrinkles his brow, concerned. Turning away, he head downstairs.
Marjorie is preparing dinner. Across the room, the kitche playing... ON TELEVISION is the evening news. A photo of Drew and Am appears above the NEWSCASTER.
... Friends and neighbors came to pay respects for Drew and Amanda Gilbert, who died in a head-on collision Saturday... Chase enters the kitchen, eyes moving to the TV.
Those poor people. I saw Gus this morning... he looked terrible. Chase pulls his eyes away from the broadcast as Marjorie dinner on the table. Chase yells upstairs.
Geoff, dinner's ready! (after no reply)
Geoff?!
I'm not hungry. Chase gives Marjorie an apologetic look and rises from th Meanwhile, the news broadcast continues. A photo of Clyde on the screen.
...in other news, the disappearance of a Ludlow youth remains a mystery. Clyde Parker was last seen on Saturday afternoon. His motorcycle was found off Highway 62...

Chase pushes open the door. A spring coil pulls the CREAK closed behind him. One look at the attic and Chase turns A huge window at the far end of the room allows the moonl reach all corners of the spacious old attic... All of Renee's belongings have been unpacked. The entire been converted into a museum-like room, down to the last  meticulous detail. A room in preparation for Renee's retu Gauzy curtains billow out from some unseen draft. Picture Renee rest everywhere. Awards. Memorabilia... GEOFF is seated before the brightly lit, three-way theatr mirror, casually setting out Renee's make-up.
Geoff... what are you doing? There's an obsessive dementia in Geoff's gaze.
I'm getting things ready for Mom. Chase sighs. Obviously the strain of Drew's funeral has p much for Geoff. He moves closer.
(gently)
Mom is dead, Geoff. You know that... A creepy smile flickers across Geoff's face.
She doesn't have to be. Chase freezes as a chill runs up his spine.
What are you talking about?
I can bring her back. The same way Drew and me brought Zowie back... At this, Chase is positively spooked.
Geoff, this is crazy. Zowie didn't die.
He did. We buried him. (intense)

There's a place out in the woods... if you bury something there, it comes back alive. Chase stares at his son. This is insane. It must be. Just then, the PHONE RINGS downstairs. Geoff continues to his father.
We tried it on Zowie first. And then we did it again, when Zowie killed Gus. Drew didn't want Gus to be dead, so we brought him back, too... It's too much for Chase. His mouth is hanging agape.
(outside the attic door)
Doctor Matthews, you've got a call. It's the caretaker at the funeral home. Something about your wife's grave... Chase nods in private acknowledgement. He stares at Geoff backs away.
Look, Geoff. Just... just relax, okay. I'm going to take this call and I'll be right back. Okay? Geoff doesn't respond. Chase pulls open the door and leav
Chase is on the phone. The CALLER'S WORDS bring grave con Chase.
What?! Christ, I'll be right there... Chase hangs up, stunned. He turns to Marjorie, who's watc with a concerned gaze.
(hurried)
Marjorie, I need you to stay late. Geoff is really upset and I have to take care of this. Don't let him leave the house, alright? Chase is out the door before she has a chance to respond.
Geoff is laying on his mother's bed, weeping. Tiger sits foot of the bed. Suddenly she wakens and HISSES. From out of the darkness...
ENTERS FRAME, gently touching Geoff's side. And with its so comes her eerie LULLABY.
(a whisper)
I need you, Geoff...

slowly raises his head, bewildered. Renee's hand withdraw the darkness. He reaches out for her, but she's gone. The remains, beckoning from down the attic stairs. The attic door slowly swings open of its own accord. Geoff rises from the bed and follows.
Geoff looks into the living room as he passes. Marjorie h asleep on the sofa with the TV on.
The lullaby drifts from beyond the deadfall. The fog roll towards the distant burial ground. As Geoff moves towards deadfall, the fog converges around him.
The lure of Renee's lullaby pulls Geoff deeper into the w hear the unearthly ANIMAL HOWL once more.
Chase's van pulls to a stop behind a maintenance vehicle. Chase is greeted by the limping CARETAKER, who quickly le off across the rolling hillside.
...sorry to disturb you, Doctor Matthews, but I thought you'd want to come have a look for yourself. It's the damndest thing...
Chase stops cold, gazing at the ground before him in disb The grave is a gaping cavity. The casket has been unearth Renee's body is missing.
Jesus... (uncomprehending)
Gus did this?!
(nodding)
He stuck around after the funeral. Told me he had an order to exhume your wife. I didn't think much of it until I saw him drag the body out of the coffin... (shakes his head)

He put your wife in his truck and drove off right through Amanda and Drew's headstones... The caretaker points across the hillside... TIRE TRACKS cut through the manicured grass, cutting a pa destruction right through the field of headstones and on the fence.
I swear, nothing this weird has happened since Louis Creed dug up his boy... (beat)
You want me to notify the authorities? Chase doesn't answer, he just storms past the caretaker.
The van is speeding down the dark, open highway. Chase is car phone, frantic, waiting as it RINGS. There's finally answer...
Doctor Yolander, this is Chase Matthews, we spoke the other day... Yolander cuts him off.
(bitter)
You didn't leave town, did you.
Yolander sits in the darkness, a bottle of whiskey and a at his side. His "creatures" are all around him, eyes glo reflected moonlight. His voice is slurred. The voice of s who's already damned.
You sorry bastard. You stayed. I have nothing more to say to you, Matthews...
(desperate)
Look, just tell me one thing. Did I treat an animal that had been brought back to life? Did I?!
What do you think?
Chase grips the carphone tightly, his knuckles white.
Believe what you saw, Matthews. The dog was dead.
My God... (mounting horror)
...how is that possible? You have to help me, Doctor Yolander. I don't know what I'm dealing with here! They've dug up my wife...
(cutting him off)
I'm retired from my practice, Matthews. It's your practice now, and it's your problem. (beat)
God help you...
(screaming)
Wait! Don't hang up! But Yolander does. And now we hear the DIAL TONE.

Shit! Chase flings the carphone down, looking up as... An approaching potato truck ZOOMS by. Blinding headlights BLARING HORN. Chase barely swerves out of the way. Recovering from the scare, Chase reaches over and opens t compartment. He pulls out his gun and sets it on the seat him.
Geoff climbs the stone steps, reaching the flattop meas. short, looking over the clearing...

is standing in the center of the burial ground. He's HUMM mimicking Renee's feminine tone. Now he stops and slowly regarding Geoff with dead eyes. He's holding a pickaxe an at his side. Gus looks to the ground at his side. Geoff follows his ga

head_text.subj: A VISION OF RENEE'S GRAVE APPEARS -

text: Headstone. Manicured grass. Thriving flowers. As if it ha uprooted from her resting place at Pleasantville and set right in the middle of the Micmac ground. And now, the vision of Renee's grave fades away. In its p bundle of white: RENEE'S SHROUDED BODY. Gus raises the pickaxe, offering it to Geoff.
You bury your own, Geoff. Geoff slowly nods and approaches, seduced beyond reason.
Marjorie stirs on the couch, blinking her eyes open at th of a THUD upstairs. Otherwise, the house is dark and sile
Geoff?
Marjorie starts up the long, dark flight of stairs to the The thin night-shirt she's wearing does little to protect the sudden cold. She clutches herself, shivering.
Geoff? You okay up there?

Marjorie cautiously pushes open the door. Her concern for forgotten as she beholds the Renee Hallow memorabilia. She moves about Renee's unpacked belongings in bewildered reverence. The gauzy curtains billow about Marjorie like ghosts. And glimpses something beyond the curtains...

stands in the shadows, wearing the BEADED PEACH DRESS tha Marjorie had admired earlier. For a moment we think it's but as Marjorie draws closer, we see that the dress has b fitted onto a dressmaker's model. Marjorie lays a hand on the fabric, feeling the contours design.
Chase's headlights sweep across the front of the dark hou Pulling to a stop, Chase opens the van's door...

LEAPS out of the darkness, sinking his teeth into Chase's shoulder. Chase is thrown back over the car seat, grappling with th nightmare dog as it tears into him again and again... Chase SCREAMS, reaching back for the gun. He grabs hold o swings it around... FIRES... Zowie is BLOWN backwards, clear out of the car, spraying with BLOOD... Zowie lands outside on his feet, looking stunned. His che ruined mess. Zowie WHIMPERS and drags himself weakly towa front porch. Chase stumbles out of the van, clutching the gun. He's bl profusely.

An old saw is laying in a pile of sawdust next to a squar that's been cut in the base of the front door. Chase gives it a look as he tries the door. It's unlocked enters, bringing with him an illuminating swath from his  headlights.

Chase's headlights stream through the windows, distorting interior. The house looks like it's been through a tornad trail of BLOODY PAW PRINTS leads into the kitchen. The st repulsive. Grimacing, Chase has to keep himself from gagg
Jesus... As Chase moves forward, he catches sight of...

standing in a swath of light. At Gus' feet is Zowie, tong lolling out of his mouth. Dead for the second time. Scatt around the dog are various tools. Propped against the wall is the cut out square of wood. I fitted with hinges at the top.
Gus, what are you doing?! Gus glances down at the dead dog.
(dead-pan)
I was building a doggy door.
God damn it Gus, you dug up my wife! What the fuck is going on around here?! Gus brings a cordless electric drill up from his side, po at Chase in a threatening manner.
(grins)
A little drilling. A little killing. As Gus moves forward, Chase gets a good look at him for t time. He doesn't look even remotely alive.

Holy shit! Chase levels his gun with a trembling hand. Gus stabs the air with the drill, feeding on Chase's horr Chase pulls the trigger. A bullet pounds Gus' chest. A SP FLESH explodes from his back. Unphased, Gus regains his balance.
God I hate when that happens... Before Chase can squeeze off the next round, Gus rips the his grip...
You got a permit for that? Opening the chamber, Gus empties the remaining bullets an the gun aside.

Didn't think so. Gus fires up the drill. The bit spinZZZZZZ. He DIVES at C knocking him back against the counter. The drill bit SINK CHASE'S ARM... Chase SCREAMS as Gus withdraws it. Now, he presses it int shoulder. Chase is on the verge of blacking out now. The unbearable... Gus withdraws the drill once again, aiming now for Chase'
(maniacal)

No brain, no pain, Chase. Think about it... The whirling drill bit is millimeters away from Chase's e clutches Gus' arm, trying to force the drill aside... At the last second, adrenaline kicks in and Chase diverts drill. It SINKS INTO the counter-top nearby... STUCK. Gus ROARS, lashing out, but Chase manages to duck away... Chase catches sight of HIS GUN on the floor. He scrambles scooping it up... BULLETS are rolling across the floor every which way. Cha his palm down on one and desperately fumbles with the cha Gus' hands CLAMP DOWN around Chase's neck. He swings Chas and SLAMS him against the wall, lifting him off his feet. Chase GASPS as the life is literally crushed out of him.. He brings the gun up beneath Gus' chin and jams it into h throat. Gus just keeps on throttling him...
(insane)

Just remember, Chase... I had Renee first... and now I'm gonna have her last... BLAM! The top of Gus' head BLOWS off. His BODY is thrown the incredible force, tumbling him to the kitchen floor w HEAVY THUD. Chase sucks in precious air, then his head snaps up.
Geoff!
Chase stumbles from the house. It's a wonder he's even co He swings open the van door and throws himself inside, si key into the ignition.

Marjorie is now seated before Renee's theatrical make-up entranced. She's wearing the beaded peach dress. With the help of Renee's vast array of cosmetics, Marjori turned herself into a stunning beauty. The lipstick isn't quite right. Turning to the countertop magnifying mirror, she carefully touches up her ruby red face fills nearly the entire mirror... ...except for one rim, which reflects the dark, shadowy a behind her. A HUGE EYE joins her reflection in the distorting mirror. nearly jumps out of her skin. She spins around...
Jesus, Geoff! Don't sneak up on me like that! ...but no one is there. THE MAKE-UP MIRROR catches another glimpse. Renee's RED L magnified tenfold. The lips begin to move...
(a whisper)

Did you really think you could be like me? Renee's fist swings in, SMASHING a panel of the mirror... Marjorie raises her hands to protect herself against the glass. And as her hands come down, she finds... Renee standing before her. Her ghostly form silhouetted b moonlight. Curtains billowing around her. We never fully Marjorie's face goes white with fear.
Such a young face... but you've got potential... Renee grabs a fistful of Marjorie's hair, viciously YANKI head back...
We'll do the eyes first. You always start with the eyes... Renee lashes out, SLASHING a mirror shard across the skin Marjorie's right eye. Marjorie SCREAMS.
Geoff awakens at the commotion upstairs. He rocks forward from his bed.
Geoff pauses at the base of the attic stairway, looking u open door. All he hears are the faint SOUNDS of movement.
Marjorie? You know you're not supposed to be in the attic. Geoff starts up the stairs.

Geoff trepidatiously enters. He weaves through the maze o curtains. And then he sees her... Renee is standing in the midst of the attic. She's perfec up. Gorgeous. Just as she was on the day she died. She sm warmly.
Mom...
I came back for you, Geoff. We're going to be together again. Renee raises her outstretched arms to receive him. Throug haze of his tears, Geoff doesn't see the sinister, vacant her eyes.
Reaching the house, Chase SKIDS to a stop across the lawn

Chase cautiously enters with the gun in his grasp. The sp swings the CREAKING door shut behind him. From Chase's vantage point, he can't see them yet. He mak way around the stripped dressmaker's model, past an uprig dressing mirror. And then he sees...
Slumped against Renee's bed like a ragdoll. We can only s of her face. It looks untouched. Chase reaches for her...
Marjorie? Marjorie's head rolls sideways, exposing the other half o face. The skin has been stripped from her skull and peele Chase turns his head away. And that's when he sees them..
Holding each other tightly. Geoff has his head buried in breast. Renee looks up from her son, meeting Chase's gaze voice is both seductive and terrifying.
Hello, Chase. Chase gasps. The word "horror" doesn't do the moment just
Oh my God...
We can try again, Chase. We can make it work this time. Chase sinks back against the wall. He's lost a lot of blo his strength is leaving him.
(shaking his head)
No...
Don't you love me anymore, Chase?
You're not Renee... Renee's dead... (screaming)
Geoff! Get over here now! But Geoff just holds his mother tighter. A hint of annoya flickers through Renee's eyes. She strokes Geoff's hair.
(looking at Chase)

Geoff, honey, why don't you go downstairs. Your father and I need a moment alone. Do it for me? Geoff looks up at his mother, mesmerized. She releases hi the embrace. He brushes past Chase without a glance and h the attic door.
Geoff... Geoff pauses at the door, looking back. Renee's words hav hauntingly familiar ring...
I love you. Geoff smiles. Turning away, he opens the door and...

is standing there, an AXE perched on his shoulder. His fa torn to shit, bones and brain matter exposed. He's covere head to toe in dirt and clotted blood. He looks worse tha the undead we've seen. A total walking nightmare.
(grinning)

Hey, Junior. Wanna play? WHOOSH! Clyde swings the axe, sinking it into the wall ju front of Geoff's face... Geoff tumbles back onto the floor, snapping out of his tr Clyde brings the axe down... ...and Geoff rolls to the side, barely avoiding decapitat
Geoff! Chase stumbles forward to rescue his son. As he does so, brings the axe back up, SMASHING Chase in the head with t end... Chase goes down. Unconscious.
Oops! Looks like Daddy got a boo- boo... Clyde turns his gaze back on Geoff.

Now, where were we? Geoff shuffles backwards across the floor as Clyde moves room. Renee passes behind Clyde. She SLAMS the attic door shut off the knob with a jerk of the wrist, locking them all i Scared out of his wits, Geoff makes it to his feet. Clyde again and misses... Geoff grabs hold of the axe handle, struggling, and the t go down...

Moves to the vanity. She sweeps a hand across it, sending everything crashing to the ground. Crystal perfume bottle SHATTER, spilling their contents over the floor. Renee reaches for a lighter and flicks it on. She touches flame to the perfume-soaked floor... FLAMES roar into existence, racing across the floorboards igniting the curtains... We see the flames reflected in Renee's soulless eyes.

As they wrestle with one another across the floor. Bloody drips from Clyde's face. He flashes a feral snarl. Clyde LUNGES forward and tears into Geoff's shoulder with teeth... Geoff SCREAMS. His hands grope blindly for a weapon and c mirror shard. He JABS it up and into Clyde's eye... Somehow, Geoff manages to roll out from under Clyde. He r his feet... Clyde lets loose a DEMONIC ROAR. He charges, SLASHING the wildly, knocking aside curtains and dressing models alike Nothing's going to stop him. Nothing. Flames are consuming the attic, licking the rafters, igni canopy drapings... devouring everything. SMOKE is rolling the floor... Geoff reaches a far wall. He's trapped in a corner. There nowhere else to go. Behind Geoff is a CIRCUIT BOX. INSULA CABLES run from the box down through the attic floor. Geo turns... And here comes Clyde...
Here it comes, buddy! HERE IT

Clyde swings. Geoff ducks. The axe hits the circuit box b him, severing the insulated cables... As Clyde rips the axe out of the wall for another try, Ge reaches for one of the SPARKING CABLES. Clyde raises the axe above his head...
Eat it, ass-hole...

...and Geoff shoves the live cable into Clyde's mouth! SPARKS shoot out of Clyde's eyes and ears. He jerks back forth, writhing in a horrific replay of Renee's electrocu Then Clyde's face BLOWS APART in a gout of ruined flesh a FLAME. The circuit is blown and the SMOKING BODY falls... Geoff drops the cable. The blazing inferno is closing in. to Chase... Chase is barely conscious. Geoff drops to his knees and p father to his feet...
Don't leave me again, Geoff! Geoff turns...
is standing in the midst of the FLAMES, reaching out. The and mortician's wax she wears fall victim to the heat and "face" begins to MELT AWAY...

Don't leave me alone! Geoff turns away, horrified. With Chase on his shoulder, reaches the door. Locked. Geoff sets Chase against the wa He spots the AXE, still clutched in Clyde's hand. Geoff d axe free from the dead boy's grasp and goes to work on th Ignoring Renee's CRIES, Geoff swings the axe again and ag chopping the door apart. He coughs through the smoke. The are almost upon them... Finally, the wood splinters apart. Geoff reaches through grasps the outside handle, pulling the door open. Then he and lifts Chase up once more... At the door, Geoff pauses for one final, tearful look bac his face hardens and he turns away, pulling Chase to safe
Alone in the fiery storm, SCREAMING. Flames devour her fl white dress. Her face doesn't even look remotely human an And as the inferno slowly closes in, we...
We PULL OUT from a sign on the door that says "CLOSED". Chase is just now locking up the door. He's bandaged up, little worse for the wear, but happy to be alive. He turn grinning...
stands near the van, holding Tiger in his arms.
All set?
All set. Chase joins Geoff at the van and together they climb insi starts the engine, pulling away from the office.
As it moves off down the street, passing the familiar lan sleepy Ludlow.
We follow the van as it sweeps out of town. Ludlow looks perfect from our bird's eye vantage point. Charming and q
So where're we going?
Anywhere but here. We continue rising up into the brilliant blue sky, losing amidst the rolling Maine countryside and we
RUSHING over the woods, just above the tree tops. It's an swaying green beneath us. A forest as ancient and mysteri anything on the Earth.

The endless trees fall out from under us. We find ourselv the flattop mesa of the Micmac burial ground, swooping do The ground surges towards us. We see Renee's OPEN GRAVE. The quality of light is different now. We hear the wail o LONESOME WIND, and perhaps, the WHISPER of something alto alien. And on the unsettling note, we...
